comments.value: Larry from Liberty is planning to commission an interactive map for their website. He will contact us at some point for more advice on how to incorporate it into the site, probably under http://www.liberty-human-rights.org.uk/about/.

He has decided to do a google map. So his current requirements are for a new template based on their standard content template, but with a placeholder to allow him to embed some map code, to be placed in their About section. He will email us with more details in due course.

subject: New map for Liberty website
description: Larry from Liberty is planning to commission an interactive map for their website. He will contact us at some point for more advice on how to incorporate it into the site, probably under http://www.liberty-human-rights.org.uk/about/.

comments.value:
From: Steven Hughes <Steven.hughes@london2012.com>

I’m after a bit of advice ... on this page of the Learning Legacy
website (http://learninglegacy.london2012.com/themes/sustainability/research-summaries.php),
I need to link to a document which is on an external site. The trouble
that I am having is that as the page is set up as a publication list
and I am unable to add a group (when using page editor) in order to
link directly to the external site.

As this is not a branded London 2012 document we don’t want this paper
to site on the LL site, we only want to link to it BUT it does need to
site under the sustainability/research summary theme.

Is there anyway around this? Any advice welcome.
Jamie, I think you have already dealt with this. If so, go ahead and close it.

comments.value:
From: Andy Watkins <Andy.Watkins@london2012.com>

Someone has found a bug with the torchbearer search. It appears the
search fails if the TB has a hyphen in their name. There’s one example
in the email below, and I’ve also verified it’s a problem with ‘Keia
Wardman Wardman-trerise’.

From: Sarah Cottier

Sue Holland-Leavans – if you type in Sue she is on the second page of
Sues however if you type sue Holland – her name comes up in the
dropdown box but then if you click on her name it says no results
found?
Treating as high priority.
Fixed.

Hi Jacob,
Unless I misunderstand your question, the data currently IS exported in a format that allows sorting/searching.
i.e. it currently contains elements like:
  <page id="2684795" path="photos/2010/1/jonathan-edwards-at-the-london-2012-roadshow-in-stafford-67369.php" date="25 Jan 2010" name="Jonathan Edwards at the London 2012 Roadshow in Stafford"/>
i.e. they contain a "date" attribute (corresponding to the "creation date" in our CMS).
Is this not what you're looking for?
If we need to amend the api call, how would you like to filter by date? i.e. would you need to specify a from/to creation-date?
Thanks,
Kieran

Thanks Kieran,
The date is what I’m looking for but I want to be able to only look for content created since the end of November 2011 and there’s no way (that I can see) in the attached list to sort the data in the way, not in that format anyway??
Many thanks,
Jacob

I can change the date so that it is in the following format:

 YYYYMMDD

(e.g. "20100527").

Would this help?
But would the content then be listed in date order? That’s the issue really.

Ok, the data is now order by creation-date.
In some circumstances this does not correspond with the path in the CMS.
For example:

<page id="2005842" path="photos/2008/11/aquatics-centre-at-night-60949.php"
date="6 Mar 2009" name="Aquatics Centre at night"/>

I can only presume that this is the result of pages being retrospectively
created (i.e. created after the date to which they relate). The important
thing, from your point of view, is that the data is now ordered by the date
that appears in @date attribute.

Please let me know whether this is as required.

Kind regards,

Kieran

This is great. Many thanks indeed.
Jacob
Closing ticket

This is a follow-up to your previous request #7059 "Redirect details request"

Hi Jamie,
Hope you’re well. Just wanted to pick this conversation back up from a month or so back.
Is it possible to have the redirect url’s and ‘short’ SEO URL’S exported into doc’s – possibly excel – please?
This would be a real help.
Many thanks,
Jacob

From: Jamie Unwin [mailto:notifications-support@postcms.zendesk.com]
Sent: 19 January 2012 15:45
To: Jacob Melton
Subject: [PostCMS support] Re: Redirect details request
Marking as high.

Hi Jacob,

As you're aware, there are three broad types of redirection/rewriting that
are used on the london2012.com site.

SEO-friendly rewrites: All pages on the site have a "canonical" path (a
path which contains 0 or more section names, followed by a filename [with a
.php extension]). As these are not particularly SEO-friendly, pages can
also be assigned an SEO-path. The client is NOT served a redirect, the path
is rewritten on the server. These are contained in SEO.csv, attached.

"Marketing" redirects: Paths that are shortened for ease-of-remembering
(e.g. for advertising campaigns). A permanent redirect is served. These are
contained in Marketing.csv, attached. Note that a few of these actually
redirect to external sites.

Ad-hoc redirects/rewrites: Links/paths that have been circulated/published
erroneously. Plus some paths that have deliberately been changed, but that
might have been extensively linked to. Plus some sensible redirects for
deleted pages.
Plus some url-rewrites to generate nicer urls for certain parts of the
website (for example /path/to/$id => /path/to/file.php/id=$id).
As these are more varied than the above rewrites, it is not really possible
to express them as simple "X gets mapped to Y" rules. Therefore I'm
attaching the relevant Apache configuration directives which you can use or
ignore, depending on requirements. If you need any more information about
these rules, please ask me.

Kind regards,

Kieran
Marking as solved.

Hi Rachael,



Please see below an outline of a new section of the site that we need to develop ahead of a launch in March,

If at all possible I'd like to arrange a kick-off call this week to discuss the below in further detail.



Thanks,



Tom



Our Torchbearers



We need to build a new part of the Olympic torch relay section of London2012.com in order to display our successful torchbearers.

This will consist of two new pages, a search page and a torchbearer page. Both pages should use the torch brand and be consistent with the existing torch section.



The search page



Visitors should be able to browse and search successful TBs by the following criteria:

*         Name (full name)

*         Torchbearing day and date "Day 1 - 19 May"

*         Torchbearing community



On running a search a list of TBs matching the selected criteria will be displayed. The list will display the following information for each TB:

*         Thumbnail photo or holding image if not available - (image will be square)

*         Full name

*         Torchbearing community

*         Torchbearing date

*         Link to view full details and nomination story



This will sit in an ordinary three columned page template, taking up the middle column.

The right hand side should have select includes - the usual 220x120 advert, related photos, and potentially a shop promo specifically for torch products.





Torchbearer Page



On choosing to view a TB's full details a page will be displayed with the following:

*         Thumbnail  photo - same as on search page

*         Full name

*         Age (tbc)

*         Torchbearing community

*         Torchbearing date

*         Home town

*         Nomination story

*         Chosen by (e.g. LOCOG, Coke, Samsung, Lloyds, BOA, etc)


The torchbearers will be announced on March 12th so we will be looking to complete this section ahead of then to launch at the same time.


Tom Price-Stephens
Assistant New Media Producer
London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games Ltd
Switchboard: +44 (0)20 3 2012  000 Extension: 381
Mobile: +44 7540 258 453
www.london2012.com
www.facebook.com/london2012
www.twitter.com/london2012
www.youtube.com/london2012

E-mail.
             
Nothing in this message or its attachments is intended to create legal relations between us unless there is an express statement creating such relations or this message contains an authorised purchase order.
                                     
Internet communications cannot be guaranteed to be timely secure, error or virus-free. The sender does not accept liability for any errors or omissions.

http://www.london2012.com
<hr width="100%">

Up to 8,000 torchbearers in about 1,000 communities.

To be made available periodically (throughout March, April and May) as a CSV file.

Images for each torchbearer will be made available separately using a naming convention that will follow an ID in the CSV file.
Awaiting sample CSV file.
Proposed launch date: March 19.
Sample CSV file received.
Markup likely to be arriving from Cogapp today.

Danny, example profile images attached. These are all the images we have for the sample of 100 TBs we sent you. There are only 68, which is probably good as it allows us to test the display of the generic profile pic for those that don't have their own image.

Btw, we are going to allow TBs to request their images be deleted (but are not going to allow them to ask us to update or edit them, for resourcing reasons). Once we've launched will I be able to delete images myself via the CMS or will I need to ask you to do this?

Thanks,
Andy
Templates attached.

Comments on templates:
pageone.html - with js turned off the community dropdown will not appear
pageone-st2.html - with js turned off this is stage 2 of community search

Who? box - remove it. This is not wanted.

Related photos and videos should be exactly the same as on the corrent torch site, e.g. http://www.london2012.com/games/olympic-torch-relay/carrying-the-olympic-flame/

The new pages are going in the /carrying-the-olympic-flame sub-section (unless we hear differently).

As this will need quite a bit of testing, can it initially be built in the test directory? I only want to freeze the OTR section a few days before the announcement.

Ta,
Andy

Got it, Andy.

We may have something of a problem with "Communities". There are no "region" data in the CSV export from Roadrunner. Furthermore, there is more than one "Newport". 

We do have the Community Latitude and Community Longitude, but this might well require a non-trivial (i.e. time-consuming) mapping of community names to locations. 

Is there any way of getting regions exported out of Roadrunner? 

Failing that, could you give us a list of duplicate community names along with their region and longitude and latitude, as they appear in Roadrunner?

I’ve asked if this is possible Danny. If not, you should be able to figure it out based on day number rather than the lat/longs.

Andy
From Andy: "the URL we’ll use for the TB search page is /olympic-torch-relay-torchbearers. (This is the SEO URL, we may find something a bit shorter for marketing purposes.)"

From Tom: 

We are currently scrapping the torchbearer detail page.
 
On the torchbearer search page we will:
1.       Increase the image size to 77x77px

2.       Display the age and hometown fields (as well as community)

Danny, you will be able to pick up a near complete set of images from the following FTP server shortly.

URL: london2012.ftpstream.com
Login: tbphotos
Password: 9Weqazuy

We hope to process a few more tomorrow.
Finally! :)

As just discussed, we are expecting a list (I think quite a short one) of pages that are going to be renamed along with the pages that are going to link to the new torchbearers section. Because all of /games/olympic-torch-relay/ is currently locked on staging, any links from outside that section that link into the section could potentially be broken if they are published prematurely. 

The general rule is that any section that is locked on staging should be changed with extreme caution.

We also need to agree a timetable for launch this week.
